Define power class.  Definition 5.10 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 17, but we also let it apply to proper classes, i.e. those that are not members of ` _V ` .  When applied to a set, this produces its power set.  A power set of S is the set of all subsets of S, including the empty set and S itself.  For example, if ` A = { 3 , 5 , 7 } ` , then ` ~P A = { (/) , { 3 } , { 5 } , { 7 } , { 3 , 5 } , ` ` { 3 , 7 } , { 5 , 7 } , { 3 , 5 , 7 } } ` ( ~ ex-pw ).  We will later introduce the Axiom of Power Sets ~ ax-pow , which can be expressed in class notation per ~ pwexg .  Still later we will prove, in ~ hashpw , that the size of the power set of a finite set is 2 raised to the power of the size of the set.  (Contributed by NM, 24-Jun-1993.)
